intro: Neogoodenia, commonly known as the Australian star gooseberry, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Goodeniaceae. It is native to Australia and includes several species that are typically shrubs or small trees. The plants are characterized by their showy, star-shaped flowers that often have five petals. Neogoodenia species are adapted to a variety of habitats, including dry forests and heathlands. They play an important role in local ecosystems by providing food and shelter for native wildlife.
